transcript_chunks.text: I'm straight up obsessed with akane a 5 out of 5 Indie title from Brazil akane is a 2d hack and slash game that's as simple as it is addictive urakane and you won't survive the night in mega Tokyo but the only question is how many Yakuza will you take with you armed with your Katana and gun the goal is to kill as many men as you can in this one hit one kill battle the gameplay evolves as gun toting enemies cyber ninjas and in every 100 Kill Boss are introduced but we're always in the same neon Splash Square rocking the same badass beats while it might look like button mashing there's a flow state to the game that's Heavenly as you race into crowds slice enemies in half and jet to another section of the map to recover or attack and there's a chance to make Akana your own the game presents you with 5 challenges that reward you with gameplay changing gear that'll give you more stamina the ability to Sprint and so on so you can choose to have a just try to kill as many people as possible

you with 5 challenges that reward you with gameplay changing gear that'll give you more stamina the ability to Sprint and so on so you can choose to have a just try to kill as many people as possible run or or focus on one of the challenges to see what gun Katana or shoe you can unlock to try to shake up your playstyle akane just dropped on PlayStation and Xbox this week but it's been out on Steam and switch for quite some time and I can't believe I've never heard of it even better you can NAB the game for either four or five bucks depending on your platform this is a game I've been starting and ending my gaming sessions with because
